meanings.definition: Resembling or relating to the color umber.
meanings.sent1: The umbery walls of the room gave it a warm and earthy feel.
meanings.sent2: Her painting featured various umbery tones that blended beautifully together.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally spilled umbery paint on his shoes, creating a unique pattern.
meanings.sent4: The forest at dusk had an umbery hue, like a blanket of rich soil.
meanings.sent5: The old book had an umbery cover that hinted at the stories within.

meanings.sent1: She picked out a lovely umbery scarf to match her winter coat.
meanings.sent2: The artist mixed yellow and black to create the perfect umbery for his landscape.
meanings.sent3: The dog's fur had an umbery tint that shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The umbery of the fallen leaves signaled the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent5: The delicious chocolate had a rich umbery color that tempted everyone.

meanings.sent1: The umbery sky foretold an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: His hands were umbery from working in the garden all day.
meanings.sent3: The old statue had an umbery patina that added to its antique charm.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed through the umbery canyon, reflecting the surrounding cliffs.
meanings.sent5: The umbery feathers of the owl camouflaged it perfectly against the tree bark.
